data.meta_description: Discover life events, stories and photos about Isaac Roland Hayes (1875â1916) of DeKalb, Tennessee, United States.
data.text:
When Isaac Roland Hayes was born on 15 April 1875, in DeKalb, Tennessee, United States, his father, James Ervin, was 38 and his mother, Mary M. Hayes, was 39. He married Rebecca Ellen Bishop on 9 January 1898, in Clarksville, Montgomery, Tennessee, United States. They were the parents of at least 4 sons and 1 daughter. He lived in Central City, Muhlenberg, Kentucky, United States in 1910. He died on 28 January 1916, in McMinnville, Warren, Tennessee, United States, at the age of 40, and was buried in Mount Holly Cemetery, Smithville, DeKalb, Tennessee, United States.

Do you know Isaac Roland? Do you have a story about him that you would like to share? Sign In or Create a FREE Account

1876 Â· The First Worlds Fair in the U.S.

The First official World's Fair, was held to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the signing of the Declaration of Independence in Philadelphia. 37 Countries provided venues for all to see.

1878 Â· Yellow Fever Epidemic

When a man that had escaped a quarantined steamboat with yellow fever went to a restaurant he infected Kate Bionda the owner. This was the start of the yellow fever epidemic in Memphis, Tennessee. By the end of the epidemic 5,200 of the residence would die.

1890 Â· The Sherman Antitrust Act

This Act tried to prevent the raising of prices by restricting trade. The purpose of the Act was to preserve a competitive marketplace to protect consumers from abuse.
